intro: Alexitoxicon rossicum, commonly known as the Rossian poisonflower, is a rare and toxic plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant contains several potent alkaloids, which make it highly dangerous if ingested. Due to its toxicity, it is rarely cultivated and is of interest primarily to botanists and toxicologists.
